review: I have had the Fire TV for 2 months or so. I had been using my older LG BluRay that would still stream Amazon. but the buffering and poor directory setup was frustrating. I am so impressed with the Amazon unit I am buying my daughter one to replace her Roku or whatever she has. Amazing HD quality, and it might have buffered twice the whole time I've had it, and that was during peak Internet times. All pros so far except one minor complaint. It would be nice to be able to set up a playlist to play consecutive movies/programs without having to stop and restart the next one.like my MX Player Pro does. Or if the function is there, I don't know how to use it. Basic instructions are readily available, but tracking down more advanced features are harder to locate.All in all. my highest recommendation. And I got it on sale for $84.00 with Amazon Prime shipping.
